item.title: S. 777, Catoctin Mountain National Recreation Area Designation Act
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on September 28, 2005

item.title: S. 777, Catoctin Mountain National Recreation Area Designation Act
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on September 28, 2005

summary.text: Catoctin Mountain National Recreation Area Designation Act - Designates Catoctin Mountain Park in Maryland as the Catoctin Mountain National Recreation Area.

Catoctin Mountain National Recreation Area Designation Act - Designates Catoctin Mountain Park in Maryland as the Catoctin Mountain National Recreation Area.

Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to acquire any land, interest in land, or improvement to land within the boundary of the Recreation Area by donation, purchase with donated or appropriated funds, or exchange.

Requires the Secretary to administer the Recreation Area: (1) in accordance with this Act and the laws generally applicable to units of the National Park System, including specified Acts; and (2) in a manner that protects and enhances the scenic, natural, cultural, historical, and recreational resources of the Recreation Area.

Authorizes appropriations.

(This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the Senate on October 27, 2005. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Catoctin Mountain National Recreation Area Designation Act - Designates Catoctin Mountain Park in Maryland as the Catoctin Mountain National Recreation Area.

Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to acquire any land, interest in land, or improvement to land within the boundary of the Recreation Area by donation, purchase with donated or appropriated funds, or exchange.

Requires the Secretary to administer the Recreation Area: (1) in accordance with this Act and the laws generally applicable to units of the National Park System, including specified Acts; and (2) in a manner that protects and enhances the scenic, natural, cultural, historical, and recreational resources of the Recreation Area.

Authorizes appropriations.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
